properties.name: 'Mars-like Arctic'Top Stories
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperlabradorNASA plan for a return to the moon in the next decade is creating a rush of scientists trekking to some of the most remote corners of the Canadian wilderness, Canadian space officials say.

properties.name: 'Nation' falloutTop Stories
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperOttawaConservative cabinet minister Michael Chong announced his resignation today because of his opposition to the continuing Quebec-as-nation controversy, saying a Tory motion to recognize the province as a nation will provide fuel to separatists and divide the country.

properties.name: 'Nation' falloutTop Stories
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperQuebecA cabinet minister in Stephen Harper\'s government has reportedly resigned in advance of today\'s vote on a motion to recognize Quebecers as a nation within Canada.

properties.name: Big Apple a great off-season getawayTravel
properties.description: Posted by Newsmappermanhattan, NYIf you\'re looking for a great pre-holiday season getaway, then New York City, fits the bill. The Big Apple is chockablock activities, but especially this time of year there is lots to see and do but the crowds aren\'t overwhelming.

properties.name: Czech out another PragueTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperPragueOne of my favourite places in Prague is the unusual art nouveau Cafe Imperial, at 15 Na porici St., just outside the Old Town. It has a lost-in-time feel, with patrons enveloped in a hazy atmosphere of coffee, cigarettes and sugary doughnuts.

properties.name: Discovering Wellington, New ZealandTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperWellington, New ZealandThe great Wellington moment is in the Museum of Wellington City and Sea. For 12 gripping minutes, the 1969 sinking of the Wahine, a ferry between Picton, on the South Island of New Zealand, and Wellington, on the North Island, is depicted in heartbreaking grainy black and white.

properties.name: Dom Rep - it's where Canadians goTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperDominican RepublicThe Dominican Republic has vaulted quickly become one of Canada\'s hotest sun destinations. And as Laura Robin writes, the choice isn\'t whether to go, it\'s which part of the island best suits your tastes.

properties.name: Drug problemTop Stories
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperVancouver, BCA Wednesday morning, just like any other in Vancouver\'s Downtown Eastside. I\'m walking the streets with a pair of drug addicts. We step into an alleyway near the busy intersection of Hastings and Main.

properties.name: Egypt's White Desert offers antiquityTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperEgyptEgypt is a divided country - split between places with water and those without.

properties.name: El Salvador puts out a welcome matTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperEl SalvadorEl Salvador rubs off on you. And that seemingly works both ways. I was sampling the sounds, sights and scents of the maelstrom that is the Sonsonate street market when my rotund belly received a cheerful pat followed by, "Santa, me gusta" (Santa, I like it). I hadn\'t seen her coming, but in a wink she was past, leaving the nearby stallkeepers in a fit of giggles.

properties.name: Everett banks on Future of Flight CentreTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperEverett, WashingtonEVERETT, Wash. - What do John D. Rockefeller, "the world\'s largest building" and the best quiche my wife has yet tasted have in common?

properties.name: Flip-flop BlocTop Stories
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperottawaThe Bloc Quebecois will throw its support behind a government motion to recognize Quebecers as a ?nation within a united Canada,? saying that Ottawa\'s admission has moved the yardsticks forward in their quest to make Quebec a separate country.

properties.name: Get off the beaten track in IrelandTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperIrelandKiss the Blarney Stone, have a pint at the Guinness Brewery and stay in a castle on a wind-swept green hillside.

properties.name: Holland ready for Rembrandt's 400thTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperAmsterdam, HollandIt is almost impossible to turn a corner in Amsterdam these days without running into Rembrandt -- his face or name seems to adorn every banner, tram car or canal boat.

properties.name: Liberal tensionTop Stories
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperMontrealMichael Ignatieff, a 59-year-old journalist and scholar who gave up his globe-trotting life to run for Parliament, is set to win the first ballot at the Montreal Liberal leadership convention this weekend.

properties.name: Mayan immersion: Guatemala is shaking its turbulent past to become Central America's new hot spotTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperIxcan, GuatemalaIn a word, Antigua is old. It has been perched in the forested Panchoy Valley for more than 450 years, was one of the Americas\' largest cities around the time of the Spanish Armada, and was nearly wiped off the map by an earthquake three years before the U.S. Declaration of Independence was signed. Even its name means old.

properties.name: More than just a big canalTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperPanama City, PanamaKnown for its famed waterway, Panama\'s capital boasts more than just a spot to watch the ships cross through the engineering marvel.

properties.name: Ottawa packs in baggage queriesTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperOttawaAirline passengers in Canada will no longer face repetitive questioning about their baggage contents thanks to increased screening capacity, the federal government announced this week.

properties.name: Piece of heaven in PolandTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperpolandYou could say Zakopane, Poland, is blessed. After all, it was the late Pope John Paul\'s favourite recreation spot.

properties.name: Road trippin' down underTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperAustraliaIt\'s 7 a.m. in Maroochydore, a beachside town on the Sunshine Coast of Australia. A young camper emerges from his van and lifts his surfboard from the roof rack, nodding a good morning to his neighbour, a retiree with a fully loaded motorhome. He walks, barefoot and shirtless to the street and joins a long line of locals who are heading to the beach for a quick, pre-work surf.

properties.name: The charm and romance of VeniceTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperVenice, ItalyIf you\'re casting forward and seeking a romantic vacation then it\'s hard to beat the watery city of Venice. There\'s lots to love about this sinking, and sometimes stinky destination.

properties.name: The splendor and beauty of SpainTravel
properties.description: Posted by NewsmapperSpainIt isn\'t a hard sight to try and find - people engaged in passionate discussion in a cafe in Barcelona. Of course, it could just as easily be a cafe in Madrid or Seville or Cordoba or any other interesting town in Spain.

properties.name: Where mambo is king: Havana nightsTravel
properties.description: Posted by Newsmapperhavana cubaLate into my third Havana night, I was packed into La Casa del Diablo y Tun Tun, an incredible club filled with prizefighters and athletes, twirling a beautiful Spanish dentist to the best timba band in town. NG la Banda\'s nine-piece combo was commanding the stage, launching from Ravel\'s Bolero into a fiery salsa, and then, with military precision, into Usher\'s R&B hit Yeah. We dipped and spun and salsa\'d until our legs could carry us no more, another 12-hour music marathon in this capital of revolutionary sound.
